content: last st with the new colour and drop the old colour on the ws of your work you do not need to carry your different colours through your work turning chains important the ch1 at the end of the rib section does not count as a stitch the ch2 at the end of the head section counts as 1 chain space and 1 turning chain 6 the sassy scrappy beanie by off the hook creative ©2025 stitch marker the stitch marker placement indicates where the 2 sections of the beanie meet the rib section and the head section when working your row make sure you remember to move your stitch marker up in each row ensuring you don t lose the placement of where the head & brim section meet your stitch count can very easily go awry if you do not use a stitch marker # indicates when to move your sm up dealing with yarn ends to make life a lot easier work over those random scrappy colour yarn ends on your next row of mc it is noted in the pattern also refer to pictures below 7 the sassy scrappy beanie by off the hook creative ©2025 pattern method child medium to large chain 53 in mc row 1 rs continue in mc and start in the second chain from hook single_crochet 52 sts over the next 20ch place sm marking the 20th st *ch1 sk1 single_crochet* repeat * to * 16 times ch2 turn the sm marks where the 2 sections of the beanie meet the rib section = 20 sts the main head section moss stitch = 32sts keep moving your sm up each row to keep a clear indication of where the rib section begins # indicates when to move sm up row 2 ws continue in mc single_crochet into first ch1 space *ch1 sk1 single_crochet into ch1 52 sts space* repeat * to * 15 times this ends just before the sm # work 19sc blo work a single_crochet through both top loops in the last st ch1 turn row 3 rs continue in mc single_crochet into the top 2 loops of the first st 19sc 52 sts blo # change to rc at the end of your last scblo drop mc towards the ws - do not cut mc *ch1 sk1 single_crochet* repeat * to * 16 times work your last single_crochet in the chain space before the ch2 turning chain of the previous row ch2 turn row 4 ws continue in rc single_crochet into first ch1 space *ch1 sk1 single_crochet* 52 sts repeat * to * 15 times change to mc at the end of your last single_crochet in rc work # 19sc blo work last single_crochet into both of the top 2 loops cut rc leave a decent length tail to work over in the next row ch1 turn row 5 rs continue in mc single_crochet into the top 2 loops of the first st 19sc 52 sts blo #
